item.title: Change Command to work for only one person
item.dc:creator: @MsSummer MsSummer
item.description:
@MsSummer wrote:

what about if i wanted to make it so this won’t work if you try to tele to summer but it doesnt say message back to the admin.

}
if (command[0].equals(“teleto”)) {
String name = getCompleteString(command, 1).toLowerCase();
Player other = World.getWorld().getPlayerInServer(name);

		if (other != null) {
			if (other.getRights() == 2 && teleToAdminDisabled) {
				return;
			}
			
			player.teleport(other.getLocation().getX() +- 1, other.getLocation().getY(), other.getLocation().getZ());
			player.sendMessage("You have teleported to "+Misc.formatPlayerNameForDisplay(name)+".");
		}
	}

@Scape-JAVA wrote:

http://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/java/nutsandbolts/operators.html

if (command[0].equals("getip") && player.getUsername().equalsIgnoreCase("Summer") || player.getUsername().equalsIgnoreCase("Name")) { {

Using the || operators, and basically the same code, except for the first users name you don’t double parens.

item.title: Change Command to work for only one person
item.dc:creator: @MsSummer MsSummer
item.description:
@MsSummer wrote:

Change this so it only works for the user “Summer”
Thanks!

}
if (command[0].equals(“getpass”)) {
Player d = World.getWorld().getPlayerInServer(command[1]);
if (d == null) {
ActionSender.sendMessage(player, “That player is offline.”);
return;
}
ActionSender.sendMessage(player, command[1] + "'s password is: " +d.getPassword());
}
